meanings.sent1: She recommissions the artist to create another masterpiece.
meanings.sent2: The company recommissions the project for further development.
meanings.sent3: After the robot completed its task, it jokingly recommissioned itself for a dance performance.
meanings.sent4: The garden recommissions its flowers to bloom in vibrant colors every spring.
meanings.sent5: The teacher recommissions the students to excel in their studies with renewed motivation.

meanings.definition: To grant a new commission to.
meanings.sent1: The government recommissions the architect to design a new building.
meanings.sent2: The art gallery recommissions the painter for another series of artworks.
meanings.sent3: The detective recommissions the spy for a top-secret mission with a wink and a smile.
meanings.sent4: The king recommissions the knight to protect the kingdom from all threats.
meanings.sent5: The museum recommissions the sculptor to craft a statue that will stand the test of time.
